meanings.definition: The dead body of an animal
meanings.sent1: The scavengers quickly devoured the carcass of the deer.
meanings.sent2: The vultures circled above the carcass, waiting for their turn to feast.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon threw a party at the carcass, inviting all his woodland friends.
meanings.sent4: The carcass lay still, a silent reminder of the circle of life.
meanings.sent5: The stench of the decaying carcass filled the air, overpowering all other scents.

meanings.definition: The remains of a structure or vehicle
meanings.sent1: After the fire, all that was left was the burnt carcass of the house.
meanings.sent2: The rusted carcass of the old car sat in the junkyard, forgotten and abandoned.
meanings.sent3: The kids turned the snow fort into a carcass of its former glory, laughing and playing.
meanings.sent4: The carcass of the bridge stood as a testament to the power of nature's forces.
meanings.sent5: The skeletal carcass of the ship emerged from the depths, a ghostly reminder of its tragic end.
